info: The Symbolic Racism Scale was published in 2002 by P.J. Henry and David Sears in response to criticism of previous scales measuring racism, including the Modern Racism Scale. Symbolic racism is a combination of four beliefs: denial of the existence of racial discrimination, work ethic and personal responsibility for outcomes, excessive demands from minorities, and a perception of undeserved advantage.
